abstracts.cdata!:
This amendment to the Loan and
            Development Credit Agreements between Grenada and the Bank
            and the Association for the HIV/AIDS Prevention and Control
            Project (Loan 7140-GRD and Credit 3706-GRD) authorizes the
            Borrower to finance, with a share of undisbursed credit and
            loan proceeds, activities addressing new challenges in the
            prevention and control of HIV/AIDS emerging in the aftermath
            of hurricane Ivan. The Government of Grenada requested the
            reallocation of US$1.3 million into a new disbursement
            category for a new component of the Project (Part E:
            Emergency Response to Hurricane Ivan). Said component will
            finance: (1) establishing and operating the N A C
            Directorate as needed for its expanded role in preventing
            and controlling the epidemic and difficult working
            conditions post Hurricane Ivan; and (2) strengthening the
            Borrower's capacity to respond to the additional
            challenges caused by Hurricane Ivan, such as: (a) assessing
            the damages to the Borrower's health service
            infrastructure, developing and managing the implementation
            of a reconstruction and rehabilitation strategy for the
            health service delivery infrastructure and rebuilding
            facilities; (b) designing and implementing information,
            education, and communication campaigns and condom
            distribution strategies attending the populations rendered
            more vulnerable to HIV post Hurricane Ivan; (c) supplying
            people living with AIDS with drugs, food and materials
            needed to rebuild their homes.
